intro: Chaerophyllum roseum, commonly known as rose chervil, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and is also used in herbal medicine. Its cultivation requires well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
